summary: Diff adds a TransportOption concept and frontend UI/hooks to fetch options and create bookings tied to a selected option, plus a migration to add transportOptionId to bookings and new transportOptions state. However, key REQ-14/REQ-15 acceptance criteria (full option fields, deterministic default options seeding, and backend seat enforcement/decrement behavior) are not evidenced in the provided diff summary.

missing_requirements.requirement: Transport option API returns, for a destination id, options including transport type, origin, destination, departure date/time (schedule details), total seats, and available seats.
missing_requirements.reason: The TransportOption type shown only includes id, destinationId, transportType, schedule (as Text), and availableSeats. There is no evidence of origin, destination, departure date/time as a structured field, or totalSeats being stored/returned.

missing_requirements.requirement: If transport options are empty/uninitialized, backend provides a deterministic default set for existing seeded destinations.
missing_requirements.reason: transportOptions is initialized to an empty Map in both migration and main; no seeding/defaulting logic for transport options is shown in the truncated backend diff.

missing_requirements.requirement: Backend booking creation enforces seat availability by rejecting bookings that exceed remaining seats and reducing availableSeats when a booking is made.
missing_requirements.reason: Frontend performs client-side seat validation and maps backend errors, but the diff summary does not show any backend logic that decrements availableSeats or rejects over-capacity bookings.

missing_requirements.requirement: Booking history continues to work and includes enough stored detail to display the destination and schedule information associated with the booking.
missing_requirements.reason: The backend Booking type adds only transportOptionId (optional) in addition to the existing 'details' Text; the diff summary does not show getBookingsByCaller changes or any guaranteed persisted schedule/route fields beyond an optional reference id and freeform details.
